subject: Re: Testing super-class contracts (test case reuse)
msgSnippet: ... that ... use ... of ... may ... See http://www.placebosoft.com/abstract-test.html You may need to make sure your abstract test classes aren t found by ant.
messageBody:
> I would like to have a set of functional tests (black-box style)
that
> enforce the behaviors of the super class, java.io.InputStream. Then
use
> that same set of tests to ensure that the basic contracts for each
of
> the classes I write follow that contract (i.e. pass those generic
> tests). Does anyone have a suggestion for doing this? While this
> specific example pertains to java.io.InputStream the same scenario
may
> occur with any class hierarchy.
>
See http://www.placebosoft.com/abstract-test.html
You may need to make sure your abstract test classes aren't found by
ant.

Richard.
